page.title: 03INTRODUCTION TO GROVE.
page.content:
It is the second biggest village in Europe and nearly as big as the nearest town Wantage.Its population is 8740. Grove is in the county of Oxfordshire surrounded by fields and countryside. There are lots of facilities.There are two main housing estates.The houses that we have are made of brick and tile and most new houses have a fitted bathroom,kitchen, central heating and a garage.Most house holds have at least 1 car.In 1981 there were 2990 houses.A new house is being built every week.The only public transport is buses.Down St Ives Lane there is a nuclear war alarm.Most people are white but a small minority are black. by Anthony Wood and
Lee O'Sullivan
